fields.Title: PAWNSHOP / TABLE OF KNICKKNACKS
fields.Description: You look at and ask Roy about the figurines on the accessory stand.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Okay." He doesn't bat an eye. "I d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Okay." He doesn't bat an eye. "I don't like either set too much, to be honest."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't elaborate on these 'wron..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He doesn't elaborate on these 'wrong hands' -- it's unlikely that he ever will.

fields.Title: You: ""Of course." (Nod knowingly.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Of course." (Nod knowingly.)

fields.Title: You: "Step away from the table. [Leave.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: Step away from the table. [Leave.]

fields.Title: You: "(Point at the blue figurines.) "Wha..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Point at the blue figurines.) "What exactly are these?"

fields.Title: You: "(Point at the blue figurines.) "Are..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Point at the blue figurines.) "Are these royalist soldiers?"

fields.Title: You: "Inspect the knights on horseback."
fields.Dialogue Text: Inspect the knights on horseback.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Maybe.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Maybe."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Try to find something pretty and co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Try to find something pretty and cool here. Then use it to win her back!

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""There's been a lot of *interest* i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "There's been a lot of *interest* in that particular figurine. I had to hide it so it wouldn't fall into the wrong hands."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""The Headless FALN Rider. It's an u..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Headless FALN Rider. It's an urban legend -- about a man who rides the streets of Revachol sporting a FALN tracksuit. As you can see, he's missing his head." He points at the decapitated figurine.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "That was a very smooth salesman's g..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That was a very smooth salesman's grin that almost comes off as earnest. You should learn from him.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Franconigerian knights." He looks..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Franconigerian knights." He looks at the dusty figurines in the dim light. "I used to be very serious about these guys."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Oh, that's the Headless FALN Rider.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh, that's the Headless FALN Rider."

fields.Title: You: "Purchase the Headless FALN Rider an..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Purchase the Headless FALN Rider and his cap.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant studies the tiny fig..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant studies the tiny figurine in your hand. "I've heard about it," he says with amusement, "I've heard the Headless FALN Rider rides a headless bull."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I don't like either set very much,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't like either set very much, to be honest, but there are many parents among my customers."

fields.Title: You: ""It is impossible to win against th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It is impossible to win against the cohorts of capital. Ask my friend Garte, whose bitch it made me."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Fifty cents. Bargain-priced! I'll..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Fifty cents. Bargain-priced! I'll throw in the tiny cap too -- I think he's looking for it, or something. That part of the story has many interpretations."

fields.Title: You: "Win 'her' back?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Win 'her' back?

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Yes! Buy something nice! A figurine..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes! Buy something nice! A figurine.

fields.Title: You: "Inspect the figurines in rags."
fields.Dialogue Text: Inspect the figurines in rags.

fields.Title: Knick-knacks Stand: "Big men on big horses clad in lamel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Big men on big horses clad in lamellar armour and carrying flintlocks. The kind that would mow down a line of enemy soldiers in the blink of an eye.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Which ones?" The man peers from hi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Which ones?" The man peers from his glass box. "Ah! Royalist soldiers from the time of the Revolution. The uniforms are painted a bit too brightly, I suppose."

fields.Title: You: ""It's meant to give people hope --..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's meant to give people hope -- even *we* can do it."

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Cool rider, right? I knew we'd find..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Cool rider, right? I knew we'd find something worthwhile here! Buy it!

fields.Title: You: ""Wait, this looks like Ren, the ol..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wait, this looks like Ren, the old guy who was playing petanque."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "He doesn't elaborate on what that m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He doesn't elaborate on what that means -- it's unlikely that he will.

fields.Title: You: ""What is this?" (Show it to the sho..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What is this?" (Show it to the shopkeep.)

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Indeed." He immediately knows what..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Indeed." He immediately knows what you're talking about. "I think I even have his cap somewhere down here..." He looks for it. "A tiny miniature FALN cap to go with it. Yours for 50 cents."

fields.Title: You: "(Point at the knights on horseback...."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Point at the knights on horseback.) "Who are they?"

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "...a long, long time ago."
fields.Dialogue Text: ...a long, long time ago.

fields.Title: Knick-knacks Stand: "You see rows of toy soldiers guardi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You see rows of toy soldiers guarding the rest of the trinkets displayed on the table: some on horseback, others in rags, others yet in bright blue uniforms. All are stern and unyielding in their duty.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Which ones?" The man peers from hi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Which ones?" The man peers from his glass box. "Ah, those! Yes, they are. I find the paint job a bit gaudy, but children like bright colours indiscriminately."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is what the loyalists looked..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This is what the loyalists looked like, yes." He inspects the figurine. "At first. Then they wised up and got camouflage."

fields.Title: You: "Dig up a truly *cool* figurine in t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dig up a truly *cool* figurine in the box under the table.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""You're probably talking about the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "You're probably talking about the revolutionaries, yes?" the man behind the glass answers. "Yes -- they are soldiers. Revolutionary soldiers."

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "He seems to have his own take on th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He seems to have his own take on the conflict played out in perpetuity by these toys. Might be interesting to find out what it is...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm. I used to be very serious abo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Mhm. I used to be very serious about my Franconigerian knights..." He looks at the dusty figurines in the dim light.

fields.Title: Volition: "This sounds... off. You shouldn't t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This sounds... off. You shouldn't trust this guy.

fields.Title: You: "(Look at Kim, then back at Roy.) "S..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Look at Kim, then back at Roy.) "Sorry, what are we talking about again?"

fields.Title: Knick-knacks Stand: "This set of soldiers isn't meant to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This set of soldiers isn't meant to look impressive. A few have rifles, but most of them carry pistols -- some even shovels and tall sticks.

fields.Title: You: ""I wish it was more *nuanced*. As i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I wish it was more *nuanced*. As it stands, I cannot comment."

fields.Title: Knick-knacks Stand: "Toy soldiers stand guard over bowls..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Toy soldiers stand guard over bowls filled with bracelets, rings, and used cigarette lighters.

fields.Title: You: "(Point at the knights on horseback...."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Point at the knights on horseback.) "These are Franconigerian cavalry, right?"

fields.Title: Knick-knacks Stand: "That they do -- the uniforms are pr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That they do -- the uniforms are precisely the same. Some even have the same shape medals pinned to their chests.

fields.Title: You: "Inspect the blue uniforms."
fields.Dialogue Text: Inspect the blue uniforms.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Why, what's this? A headless man ri..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why, what's this? A headless man riding a horse? A headless man wearing futuristic track suit trousers that say FALN!

fields.Title: You: "(Point at the figurines in rags.) "..."
fields.Dialogue Text: (Point at the figurines in rags.) "Are these even soldiers?"

fields.Title: You: ""The Headless FALN Rider!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Headless FALN Rider!"

fields.Title: Logic: "He lost his cap when he lost his he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He lost his cap when he lost his head. Perhaps he's looking for the *head*?

fields.Title: You: ""What do you mean?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you mean?"

fields.Title: You: ""Shopkeep, what are these?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Shopkeep, what are these?"

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""A classic set. The figurines repre..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "A classic set. The figurines represent the Fifth-century Franconigerian Cavalry."

fields.Title: Knick-knacks Stand: "They're not all blue. These figurin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: They're not all blue. These figurines also wear gold coats and caps, complimented by orange trousers. They are variously posed, wielding swords and rifles with bayonets.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""I think their poverty has been exa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I think their poverty has been exaggerated for effect. When you place them next to the royalists, it doesn't seem like they could possibly win."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant studies the figurine..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant studies the figurine with amusement.

fields.Title: You: ""These are Franconigerian cavalry,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "These are Franconigerian cavalry, right?"

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Did I mention that this figurine i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Did I mention that this figurine is supposed to be lucky? Always carry it with you." He grins.

fields.Title: Interfacing: "Everything you pick out seems faded..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Everything you pick out seems faded, chipped, and sad somehow. Most of them are  just broken toys.

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes!" The man behind the glass tak..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes!" The man behind the glass takes says. "A little worn around the edges, but I'm pretty sure it's fully intact."

fields.Title: Bird's Nest Roy: ""Yes, there are several competing v..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, there are several competing versions of the story, but I believe this figurine is a more canonical representation."

fields.Title: You: ""The contrast is meant to be dishea..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The contrast is meant to be disheartening. As it ought to be."
